text: Quincy Public Hall, also known as the Quincy City Hall and Quincy Community Building , is a historic city hall located at Quincy, Hickory County, Missouri. It was completed in 1917, the hall is a one-story frame building measuring 45 feet by 26 feet. It sits on a flat stone foundation and has a high gable roof. It features a concrete entrance porch sheltered by a belfry supported by hand hewn wooden posts. The building serves as the center of the social, religious, educational, and civic structure of the hamlet of Quincy. (includes 5 photographs from 1994) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1995. ==References== Category:Government buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Government buildings completed in 1917 Category:Buildings and structures in Hickory County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Hickory County, Missouri
title: Quincy Public Hall
